casebody.data:
NATIONAL SAFETY GAS COCK CO., Inc., v. CONSOLIDATED GAS CO. OF NEW YORK. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. January 19, 1921.) No. 105. Appeal from the District Court of the United States for the Southern District of New York. Suit in equity by the National Safety Gas Cock Company, Incorporated, against the Consolidated Gas Company of New York. Decree for defendant, and complainant appeals. Affirmed. For opinion below, see (D. C.) 271 Fed. 539. Munn, Anderson & Munn, of New York City (J. K. Brachvogel, of New York City, of counsel), for appellant. Thomas L. Wilder, of Utica, N. Y., for appellee.

Before ROGERS, HOUGH, and MANTON, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree affirmed.
